codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTAdditionalDosageInstructions
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Additional Dosage Instructions
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all SNOMED CT Additional Dosage Instructions.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTAdministrationMethodCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Administration Method Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes some method codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar

codeSystems.name: AllLanguages
codeSystems.title: All Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTAnatomicalStructureAdministrationSites
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Anatomical Structure for Administration Site Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes Anatomical Structure codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: Bundle Type
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.name: CarePlanActivityPerformed
codeSystems.title: Care Plan Activity Performed
codeSystems.description: Example codes indicating the care plan activity that was performed. Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

codeSystems.name: CarePlanCategory
codeSystems.title: Care Plan Category
codeSystems.description: Example codes indicating the category a care plan falls within.  Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

codeSystems.name: CarePlanIntent
codeSystems.title: Care Plan Intent
codeSystems.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Clinical Findings
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all the "Clinical finding" [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) codes - concepts where concept is-a 404684003 (Clinical finding (finding)).

codeSystems.name: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.title: Composition Attestation Mode
codeSystems.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

codeSystems.name: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.title: Composition Status
codeSystems.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

codeSystems.name: ConditionProblemDiagnosisCodes
codeSystems.title: Condition/Problem/Diagnosis Codes
codeSystems.description: Example value set for Condition/Problem/Diagnosis codes.

codeSystems.name: DocumentSectionCodes
codeSystems.title: Document Section Codes
codeSystems.description: Document section codes (LOINC codes used in CCDA sections).

codeSystems.name: FHIRDocumentTypeCodes
codeSystems.title: FHIR Document Type Codes
codeSystems.description: FHIR Document Codes - all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: H T T P Verb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: LinkRelationTypes
codeSystems.title: Link Relation Types
codeSystems.description: Link Relation Types defined at https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml#link-relations-1

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: ListEmptyReasons
codeSystems.title: List Empty Reasons
codeSystems.description: General reasons for a list to be empty. Reasons are either related to a summary list (i.e. problem or medication list) or to a workflow related list (i.e. consultation list).

codeSystems.name: ListOrderCodes
codeSystems.title: List Order Codes
codeSystems.description: Base values for the order of the items in a list resource.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTMedicationAsNeededReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Medication As Needed Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all clinical findings from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTMedicationCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Medication Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all drug or medicament substance codes and all pharmaceutical/biologic products from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTFormCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Form Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all dose form codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

codeSystems.name: ReferencedItemCategoryValueSet
codeSystems.title: Referenced Item Category Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Made up of a set of non-healthcare specific codes and all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

codeSystems.name: RequestStatus
codeSystems.title: RequestStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of a request.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTRouteCodes
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Route Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all Route codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: Search Entry Mode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: DoseAndRateType
codeSystems.title: DoseAndRateType
codeSystems.description: The kind of dose or rate specified.

codeSystems.name: ActCode
codeSystems.title: v3 Code System ActCode
codeSystems.description:
A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:
The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.
